item.title: Star Wars: Unlimited TCG Booster Boxes Are Super Cheap At Amazon Right Now
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Star Wars: Unlimited Trading Card Game Booster Boxes and Starter Sets are on sale for extremely low prices at Amazon. Three Booster Boxes are available for over 50% off, including Legends of the Force, Jump to Lightspeed, and Twilight of the Republic. If you're interested in playing Asmodee's Star Wars TCG for the first time, the Starter Sets come with two ready-to-play decks and all of the accessories you need to dive in. Twilight of the Republic's Starter Set is discounted to only $18.80 (was $35), and Shadows of the Galaxy's Starter Set is $21.17 (was $35).

Along with the deals, Star Wars: Unlimited collectors can pick up the 2025 Gift Box for $30 at Amazon. The Gift Box comes with three exclusive cards and eight Booster Packs, which makes it a nice option for existing players and collectors as well as newcomers.

Star Wars: Unlimited - Booster Box Deals

Star Wars: Unlimited Booster Boxes include 24 packs with 16 cards each (384 cards total). The Legend of the Force Booster Box is the cheapest at $52.20 (was $120). With Amazon's deal price, you're only paying $2.17 per Booster Pack. Twilight of the Republic and Jump to Lightspeed are also discounted below $60. Amazon also has a deal on the Booster Box for Secrets of Power, the new Star Wars: Unlimited set that launched in November.

  • Legends of the Force (24 Packs) -- $52.20 ($120)
  • Twilight of the Republic (24 Packs) -- $54 ($120)
  • Jump to Lightspeed (24 Packs) -- $58.12 ($120)
  • Secrets of Power (24 Packs) -- $88 ($120)
  • Shadows of the Galaxy (24 Packs) -- $85.67 ($120)
  • Spark of Rebellion (24 Packs) -- $84.45 ($120)

Star Wars: Unlimited - Starter Sets & Spotlight Decks

The Starter Sets come with two 50-card decks, themed deck boxes, damage counters, and a quickstart guide. Each set includes one deck themed around the Rebellion and one for the Galactic Empire. The Twilight of the Republic Starter Set is led by Ahsoka and General Grievous, while Shadows of the Galaxy features The Mandalorian and Moff Gideon.

Asmodee stopped making Starter Sets after Twilight of the Republic. The last three sets have included two $25 Spotlight Decks instead. You can save on Legends of the Force and Jump to Lightspeed Spotlight Decks at Amazon. The Boba Fett Spotlight Deck is the cheapest at $18.87. In addition to the 50-card deck, each Spotlight Deck comes with a booster pack.

  • Twilight of the Republic Starter Set (2 Decks) -- $18.80 ($35)
  • Shadows of the Galaxy Starter Set (2 Decks) -- $21.17 ($35)
  • Legends of the Force Spotlight Decks
    • Darth Maul -- $21.74 ($25)
    • Qui-Gon Jinn -- $20.63 ($25)
  • Jump to Lightspeed Spotlight Decks
    • Han Solo -- $21 ($25)
    • Boba Fett -- $18.87 ($25)
  • Secrets of Power Spotlight Decks
    • Chancellor Palpatine -- $25
    • Padme Amidala -- $25

Star Wars: Unlimited TCG - 2025 Gift Box

$30

The first Star Wars: Unlimited Gift Box is basically a sampler platter, as it includes cards from four different sets. You'll get eight Star Wars: Unlimited Booster Packs, two exclusive variant cards, and one oversized leader card.

  • 2 Twilight of the Republic Booster Packs
  • 2 Jump to Lightspeed Booster Packs
  • 2 Legends of the Force Booster Packs
  • 2 Secrets of Power Booster Packs
  • Exclusive Obi-wan Kenobi Card
  • Exclusive Darth Sidious Card
  • Oversized Qui-Go Jinn Card

Browse Star Wars: Unlimited TCG by category:

For more Star Wars: Unlimited deals, check out the Amazon store pages we created based on category. Amazon has deals on several prerelease boxes right now. New players should also check out the recently released Intro Battle Hoth game for $20. Similar to Pokemon Battle Academy, Intro Battle Hoth is essentially a board game version of Star Wars: Unlimited.

  • Booster Boxes
  • Starter Sets
  • Spotlight Decks
  • 2025 Gift Box
  • Booster Packs
  • Prerelease Boxes
  • Carbonite Booster Boxes

  • Asus ROG Xbox Ally Gets $110 Discount At Amazon
  • Super Mario Galaxy Storybook Hardcover Edition Restocked With 15% Discount At Amazon
  • + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (3)

  • New Lord Of The Rings & The Hobbit Illustrated Box Set Is Back In Stock With $72 Discount

item.title: PlayStation 2025 Wrap-Up: See How Much You Played This Year
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Yearly wraps have become an annual tradition across various platforms, and PlayStation is no exception. The PlayStation Wrap website has gone live, and once again, members of the PlayStation community can explore the total number of hours spent across single-player and multiplayer games. You'll have until January 8 to check out your stats--PlayStation Wrap-Up will continue to update until then--and users can redeem a unique glass-themed avatar once they complete their tour down memory lane.

This year's PlayStation Wrap-Up also includes a look at the number of games played on PS5 and PS4, a closer look at your gaming style, and even the DualSense controller you used the most. If you've used other PlayStation accessories, such as PlayStation VR2 or the PlayStation Portal handheld, those stats will also be included in your personal wrap-up. Additionally, you can get a brief look at how active you were on PlayStation Plus throughout the year, and Sony is also offering a curated list of recommended games to try out through the subscription service, if you're a member of the Premium or Extra tiers.

Ghost of Yotei, Death Stranding 2: On the Beach, Blue Prince, and Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 were considerable timesinks, while other noteworthy releases included games like Ball x Pit, Elden Ring Nightreign, and Battlefield 6 kept players glued to their screens for many hours.

What will the 2026 edition of PlayStation Wrap-Up look like? While things can still change, some of the big upcoming releases include Resident Evil Requiem, 007: First Light, and Yakuza Kiwami 3. Of course, if it doesn't suffer another delay, we expect the November 2026 release of Grand Theft Auto 6 to rank high on next year's list of the top five most-played games.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/playstation-2025-wrap-up-see-how-much-you-played-this-year/1100-6536799/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Xbox Teases "A Lot Of Exciting Things" To Be Announced In 2026
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Xbox's Jason Ronald has teased that Microsoft has "a lot of exciting things to share" in 2026 for the Xbox's 25th anniversary. Speaking to the BBC, Ronald was asked specifically if more Original Xbox games would be coming to Xbox Game Pass. Ronald didn't confirm anything outright but said fans have a lot to look forward to for the anniversary next year.

"I can't announce anything today, but 2026 is the 25th anniversary of Xbox. And we want to celebrate the great legacy and the history that we have at Xbox, as well as defining the future of where the Xbox ecosystem is going," he said. "So, I can't confirm or deny what you are asking, but stay tuned. We have a lot of exciting things to share next year."

Also in the interview, Ronald said Xbox feels "a need but also a responsibility" to preserve games from the past and "enable them to be played in entirely new ways."

Beyond the possible addition of more Original Xbox games for Game Pass in 2026, Microsoft will release Halo: Campaign Evolved in 2026, not just for PC and Xbox, but also PlayStation 5. Additionally, it's been reported that a new live-service Halo game could be announced and released in 2026.

Many are also wondering when Microsoft will formally unveil its next-generation console platform, which is said to be a "high-end" device that may embrace some PC gaming sensibilities.

2025 was a challenging year for Xbox, as the company enacted dramatic measures such as mass layoffs, studio closures, and game cancellations against the backdrop of Microsoft's reported mandate to increase profits. Microsoft also raised the price of Xbox Game Pass significantly this year, leading some to wonder if the service is still worth it at the higher price.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Skyrim Is Now On Yet Another Platform, But There's A Way To Upgrade For Free
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Yet another version of The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim is here, with developer Bethesda Game Studios mega-hit RPG now available for Nintendo Switch 2.

Skyrim continues to conquer every platform imaginable, and this time it's specifically 2021's Skyrim Anniversary Edition that's available on Nintendo's new console. This new version of the game does come with a few additional bells and whistles not found in the original Switch version, namely Joy-Con 2 mouse-control support. It also sports improved load times and performance in addition to features found in the original Switch version of Skyrim, like Legend of Zelda Amiibo support, Zelda-themed items, and motion controls.

For those who already own the Anniversary Edition on the original Switch, the Switch 2 upgrade is available for free. Those who don't already own any version of Skyrim on Switch can buy it on Switch 2 for $60. Owners of the non-Anniversary Edition of Skyrim on Switch can upgrade to the Anniversary Edition for $20 and then receive the Switch 2 version for free. The Anniversary Edition includes the base game and its three official expansions, as well as access to Creation Club content made by players.

Skyrim truly is the gift that keeps giving for Bethesda, as it's still one of the top 10 best-selling games of all time. Its enduring appeal even surprised Skyrim's lead designer, who recently said he expected some other game to eclipse it in the years following its release. Part of the game's enduring popularity comes from Skyrim's vibrant mod scene, where players are always creating new content that can transform the world Bethesda created in surprising ways.

Bethesda is currently working on Skyrim's sequel, The Elder Scrolls VI, which was announced in 2018 but does not have a release date. In November, Bethesda's Todd Howard said the highly anticipated RPG is "still a long way off" and that he's "preaching patience" to fans. Howard has previously said he wonders if it was a mistake to announce Elder Scrolls VI so early.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
